acceptAdmin().details: Only callable by the pending admin. Resets the pending admin if succesful.

params._executorCanCall: True if selector is callable by the executor
params._functionSelector: Method signature on which the permission is changed

params._admin: Address of the administrator, that is able to perform all calls via the Firewall
params._executor: Address of the executor, that is able to perform only a subset of calls via the Firewall
params._executorCallableSelectors: Initial list of allowed selectors for the executor

proposeAdmin(address).details: This security prevents setting an invalid address as an admin. The pendingadmin has to claim its ownership of the contract, and prove that the newaddress is able to perform regular transactions.

executorCanCall.return: True if executor is allowed to call

returns._0: True if executor is allowed to call

Unauthorized(address).notice: The operator is unauthorized for the caller

SetDestination(address).notice: The stored destination address has been changed

SetExecutor(address).notice: The stored executor address has been changed

SetExecutorPermissions(bytes4,bool).notice: The storage permission for a selector has been changed

allowExecutor(bytes4,bool).notice: Sets the permission for a function selector

executorCanCall(bytes4).notice: Returns true if the executor is allowed to perform a call on the given selector

getPendingAdmin().notice: Retrieve the current pending admin address

proposeAdmin(address).notice: Proposes a new address as admin

userdoc.notice: This contract accepts calls to admin-level functions of an underlying contract, and         ensures the caller holds an appropriate role for calling that function. There are two roles:          - An Admin can call anything          - An Executor can call specific functions. The list of function is customisable.         Random callers cannot call anything through this contract, even if the underlying function         is unpermissioned in the underlying contract.         Calls to non-admin functions should be called at the underlying contract directly.
